subject: Re: [junit] Do we need to convince management of the benefits of unit       tests?
msgSnippet: ... I am not a Microsoft basher any more, but I still believe that SourceSafe is actually /worse/ than no version control. I feel similarly about ClearCase,
messageBody:
Rutherford, Michael wrote:

> > > The original lead actively fought against using source control [...]
> >
> > I don't talk to these people any more. If someone tells me that they
> > specifically don't want source control, I extend my hand, shake theirs,
> > then bid them good day. You must be at least this responsible to talk to
> me.
>
> Luckily I didn't have to fight *that* fight. By the time I arrived
> SourceSafe (better than nothing) and Ant were both in use, if only just.

I am not a Microsoft basher any more, but I still believe that
SourceSafe is actually /worse/ than no version control. I feel similarly
about ClearCase, although not as strongly.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
